Legal_Issue: Credibility and implausibility findings in refugee claim
Outcome: RPD decision set aside, case remitted for redetermination
Evidence_Type: Family history documentation, employment records, personal testimony
Legal_Provision: Section 96, IRPA - Definition of Convention Refugee
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to political opinion and family association
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Cumulative acts of persecution, subjective fear
Regulation_Cited: IRPR Section 101(1)(a) - Credibility and evidence evaluation
Application_Error: Misstatement of facts, speculative implausibility findings
Assessment_Standard: Plausibility and credibility must be based on evidence and logic
Evidence_Ignored: Key documents supporting family history and spouse's employment
Application_Factor: Delay in departure explained by escalating threats
Decision_Review_Issue: Error in credibility and subjective fear assessment
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Credibility assessments must be reasonable and evidence-based
Outcome_of_Review: In favor of applicant - remitted for new hearing
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility and implausibility of events
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to explain rejection of documents, inconsistency in evidence treatment
Procedural_Fairness: Deficient reasoning affecting fairness of process
Credibility_Issues: Alleged inconsistencies in personal narrative, unexplained delays
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to RPDâ€™s factual findings and reasoning
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (indirectly)
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide transparent and intelligible reasons
